description: From Hindi डूंगरी (ḍūṅgrī, “coarse calico”), from the name of a village.

entries.meaning: (uncountable) Heavy denim fabric, often blue; blue jean material.
examples: This fellow was in the native costume, which is literally worse than nothing, consisting only of a straw tube, about a foot long, with a shred of blue dungaree hanging from its upper end.

entries.meaning: (plural only) Pants or overalls made from such fabric.
